page.title: 08A Miners Day.
page.content: My dad works in the local coal mining industry at Silverhill Colliery. He works as a Pit Deputy. He started as an ordinary miner and worked his way up. He works in shifts. For transport he takes his car and drives approximately a mile down the road to the mine. Here he has to get changed into his working clothes, boots and helmet. Then he goes to the lift which takes the miners up and down the mine shaft. There is no door on the front of the cage{(which is what the miners {call the lift).}My dad controls between fifty and one hundred men and his job is to make sure that every man does his work properly. At the end of his shift he has a shower to get rid off the dirt and grime of the day and then he drives home. On some shifts he goes to bed as soon as he arrives at home.
